THE HISTORIC RACING LANDMARK Since 1905, Belmont Park Racetrack has been one of the most prestigious venues in American horse racing. Best known as the home of the Belmont Stakes, traditionally the final leg of the Triple Crown, the site has welcomed legendary figures such as The Wright Brothers, Jackie Kennedy, Thomas Edison and Secretariat throughout its history. Currently undergoing a major redevelopment, Belmont Park is set to debut a new state-of-the-art grandstand complete with modern amenities and hospitality—bringing a storied American tradition into the 21st century. THE PREMIER ENTERTAINMENT VENUE Next to the racecourse sits UBS Arena, New York’s newest premier live entertainment and sports venue. Home of the New York Islanders ice hockey team and a cutting-edge venue for concerts and events, the arena was designed to deliver a world-class experience for fans, artists, and athletes alike. Built with fan-first amenities, inspired by the timeless elegance of New York and powered by state-of-the-art technology, the venue is made for music and built for hockey with clear sightlines and premier acoustics. THE HOCKEY TEAM A cornerstone of New York sports heritage, the Islanders have been thrilling fans with electrifying hockey since 1972. With four consecutive Stanley Cup championships and a legacy defined by passion and perseverance, the team remains one of the NHL’s most storied franchises. Now playing at UBS Arena, the Islanders continue to bring world-class hockey to the heart of Long Island. THE NEW STYLE DESTINATION A new chapter in Belmont Park’s evolution, Belmont Park Village brings together designer shopping, delicious dining, and signature guest services in one open-air setting. Discover over 150 boutiques featuring previous seasons’ collections at up to 65% off, alongside an ever-expanding lineup of culinary and hospitality experiences. With its location next to UBS Arena and the Belmont Park Racetrack, Belmont Park Village forms the heart of a one-of-a-kind destination for fashion, sports, and entertainment in metro New York.
